definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: These success stories revolve strictly around perception and choice.
sentences.chinese: 這些成功故事主要關乎於悟性和選擇。

sentences.english: Because God hath deprived her of wisdom, neither hath he imparted to her understanding.
sentences.chinese: 因爲神使它沒有智慧，也未將悟性賜給它。

sentences.english: Intelligence is quickness to apprehend as distinct from ability, which is capacity to act wisely on the thing apprehended.
sentences.chinese: 聰明指悟性好，而能力則指可以根據悟性妥善行事。

sentences.english: Intelligence is quickness to apprehend as distinct from ability, which is capacity to act wisely on the thing apprehended.
sentences.chinese: 聰明指悟性好，而能力則指可以根據悟性妥善行事。

sentences.english: Ma Kam-yee With extraordinary savvy and constantly surpass themselves.
sentences.chinese: 馬錦儀憑着過人的悟性，不斷地超越自己。

sentences.english: It'll just make you a stronger and savvier investor .
sentences.chinese: 相反地，它會讓你成爲一個更強更有悟性的投資者。

definition: skills acquired through religious practice/(fig.) ability/skill/Taiwan pr. [dao4 hang5]
